etymology.description: 想 + 起来 = think + rise/start up → memories surface; to recall.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the act of thinking with the directional/resultative complement 起来 to express that something comes to mind. Often paired with 了 (想起来了) to mark the moment of recall.
etymology.simplification: 起來 → 起来 replaces 來 with the simplified 来, part of the standard character simplification to reduce strokes and regularize forms.

parts.english: rise; get up; upward/into action; begin to V

examples.chinese: 我终于想起来他的名字了(我終於想起來他的名字了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhōngyú xiǎngqǐlái tā de míngzi le.

examples.chinese: 看到这张照片，我一下子全都想起来了(看到這張照片，我一下子全都想起來了)。
examples.pinyin: Kàndào zhè zhāng zhàopiàn, wǒ yíxiàzi quán dōu xiǎngqǐlái le.
examples.english: Seeing this photo, everything suddenly came back to me.

examples.chinese: 一闻到那股味道，他就什么都想起来了(一聞到那股味道，他就什麼都想起來了)。
examples.pinyin: Yì wéndào nà gǔ wèidào, tā jiù shénme dōu xiǎngqǐlái le.
examples.english: As soon as he smelled that scent, everything came back to him.
